column4: hi, I'm using an Australien 3G connection shared from my phone (tethering). Ubuntu can't connect to any website no matter which browser I am using. What could be wrong? (ping commands works though)
does ping work on say 'google.com' -- that is does DNS work?
it does, yes
sometimes it even says "connected to google.com" in the browser but nothing happens after that
weird indeed
on windows it works perfectly and I can say that the network isn't that slow
and since there is 'connected' message i guess its not matter of any 'working offline'
no certainly not
'telnet www.google.com 80' -- see http://www.apacheweek.com/features/http11
it's just weird that under windows it works perfectly.. so I don't think this is a matter of authentication or similar
true indeed
thanks I'll try that.. but need to start ubuntu to do that since I have only one computer ATM
but also the browser does not know anything about what connection you are using -- and its not like network is blocked for application X (it can be done though but it requires tricks)
Check the web page i pasted
I will thanks
re my problem with connecting to sites using ubuntu.. I tried telnet but it doesn't return any status code
it should print something like
like this : http://pastebin.com/itEzZLsc
if it does not the problem truly lies somewhere in connection settings -- check your firewall (iptables -L)
then it looks like it's just extremly slow.. for me it stops at "Escape character.." and doesn't seem to do more until I hit Ctrl+C
So you get the connection up and running but data is not transferring properly .. which is quite weird indeed
using WLAN works without any problem
no problem :) thanks anyway
